snippet: An Egyptian court on Wednesday acquitted people who had been accused of organizing one of the most dramatic attacks on protesters of last year’s uprising.
abstract: Egyptian court acquits 24 loyalists of ousted Pres Hosni Mubarak, who had been accused of organizing so-called 'Camel Battle,' one of most dramatic attacks on protesters during 2011’s uprising; they were found not guilty of manslaughter and attempted murder in the episode, in which assailants on horses and camels charged into crowds in Cairo.
lead_paragraph: An Egyptian court on Wednesday acquitted people who had been accused of organizing one of the most dramatic attacks on protesters of last year’s uprising.

headline.seo: Egyptian Court Acquits 24 Mubarak Loyalists in ‘Camel Battle’

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
